content.raw:
That looks good. Do you want to add the configuration as an optional parameter to the constructor? 

    
    Application::Application(int &_argc, char **_argv, const WindowType _type, const std::string &_config="")
    

One question I have is when do we want to load the default config, and when should we not? For example, if a user wants just a mainwindow, should we load the default config? If if the user specifies plugins should the default config not be loaded?

That looks good. Do you want to add the configuration as an optional parameter to the constructor? 

Application::Application(int &_argc, char **_argv, const WindowType _type, const std::string &_config="")

One question I have is when do we want to load the default config, and when should we not? For example, if a user wants just a mainwindow, should we load the default config? If if the user specifies plugins should the default config not be loaded?
